result.execSummary:
The defendant Willem S Rella was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with victims.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Restitution was ordered to be paid joint and several with co-Defendant Anton Ouradnik. This Defendant has paid the entire amount of restitution ($8,069.50), so co-Defendant's payments made in Door County case no. 15-CF-87 should be paid to this Defendant.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections.
Perform 20 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency or organization.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Counts 1, 3, 4, 5. Defense has no objection. Court reviews max. penalties.   State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Off the record discussion regarding payment of restitution. State advises of diligent effort to pay restitution, has no objection to one final adjournment to allow Defendant to pay remaining restitution. Defense agrees. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Off the record discussion regarding restitution. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests a week or two.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that another $800 has been paid, co-Defendants are in prison, requests sentencing be put off until after May 1, has a lot to pay since he's paying it all. State has no objection. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Reetz request another date for sentencing to allow defendant time to prepay restitution. State has no objection. Sentencing set for 11/07/16 at 11:30 am. Court will have civil file continue to track criminal file. Bond remains in effect.
Sentencing hearing on July 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 3, 4, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 3, 4, 5. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who understands concept of party to a crime. Defense requests that sentencing be put off for 120 days to allow Defendant time to pay restitution. Bond continues as is.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense advises that Defendant is working toward paying restitution. Bond continues as is.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of offer that will be accepted, but has to pay restitution to avoid jail, requests status in 60 days to allow Defendant time to pay. State has no objection.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
by Elizabeth J. Wagi
No contact direct or indirect with Door or Kewaunee County Marathon gas stations, Wave Point Marina, AO.
Defense requests reduction of cash bond. State has no objection. Court amends bond to $1,000. Conditions remain the same.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conference set for August 27, 2015 at 10:00.
by State

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Brett E Reetz. Defendant Willem S Rella in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
Preliminary hearing at 07-27-2015 02:00 pm

Defense advises that Defendant would still have a job, asks Court to reconsider bond, requests signature bond. State objects. Court would consider lowering it if there is an indication it will be posted. Defense has conflict, will be appointing case.

Defendant Willem S Rella in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Willem S Rella in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
for Warrant for Communications - Nsight, Order Granting Warrant, Affidavit, Warrant, Return
Defendant was fingerprinted on 7/14.

Defendant Willem S Rella appeared by video conference. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/20/15, 10:00.
No contact direct or indirect with Door or Kewaunee County Marathon gas stations, Wave Point Marina, PJ, AO.
